intro: Myosoton, commonly known as the lesser calamint, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the carrot family. Myosoton is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks in temperate regions. It is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
